comment.author: 61225546@N02
comment._content:
I fully agree! 
Pity that wearing a bowler hat  is not common aymore.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/61225546@N02] It really is a mighty fine specimen!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I agree with you that this is an outstanding shot.  Posed but very clear, great DOF and focus and what a good looking family?  Their dress is very sombre and there is no Mammy present, was there a tragedy before this was taken?

comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: To me it seemed like they were all grouped around the hole in the middle, the missing presence of Mother. The children are so composed, that their beautiful but stony faces seem to reinforce that they're holding the sadness in. And then again, they could just be being very well-behaved and still while having their picture taken.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Well observed La Belle, a missing mother would certainly leave hole in the middle.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: As it was mentioned, it does seem striking how prominent that vacant space is on the bench where the mother should be. Perhaps she did pass away not long before this photograph was taken?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
Well, all of you, I'll be honest - too many Powers in Dungarvan in the 1901 census online, not enough time!!
However, unless we're all having an attack of the over-imaginations, there's certainly something going on here, don't you think?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 68985493@N06
comment._content: Wonderful shot! Amazing IQ for such an old print! The sober faces are typical of portraits from that era I think - you seldom see people smiling in those old portrait shots, not from sadness, just from convention I believe. Even the dog is looking very serious!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/terryhnb] Know what you mean, Terry, and well used to the sombre expressions caused by shyness and/or having to pose for ages. In fact, smily photos are rare as hen's teeth, but still wonder...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23047058@N08
comment._content: Great portrait! -- Seen in my contacts' photos. (?)

comment.author: 40089693@N07
comment._content: Very good looking family indeed... strong genes, the kids all have the same eyes & brow. No doubt the brow from their father but maybe the eye shape from their mother...

comment.author: 30972082@N04
comment._content: A strikingly attractive and dignified looking family.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
